posts.post_content:
Ugh...  
This card.  
So, hear me out.  
I love it. It's really good in a dedicated Evolve deck.  
I love the card draw, I love how beefy it gets, I love the small little interactions with all the cool stuff...  
That being said...  
It REALLY hurts using that T4 for something that won't trigger your Evolve creatures or put something with an already good P/T ratio.  
I give it a 4.5, because honestly, that downside is hardly anything after you start getting that card advantage.

posts.post_content:
So, the other day, I traded a friend a couple of rares I was never going to use. He showed me some of his rares up for trades, and a pre-release one of these was in it.  
  
'Man, I'll trade for THAT sure, lol!'  
  
'Yeah, go on then.'  
  
'... but... no, I was joking, that's a pre-release of a ridiculously awesome card.'  
  
'I've got another two pre-release ones and a regular one, can't fit the fourth in my deck. I'll trade it for that [Feral Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Feral Hydra).'  
  
'...'  
  
  
  
So, yeah. Some people. SOME PEOPLE.

Posted By: psychichobo (3/24/2013 4:44:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I recently added two copies of this to a Simic deck that I've been running for years. Ended up being very sexy alongside [Plaxcaster Frogling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plaxcaster Frogling), and she turns [Cytoplast Root-kin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cytoplast Root-kin) into a two-card draw 90% of the time.  
  
Honestly, even though the point of the deck is to play [Ixidron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ixidron) and use your buffed morph creatures to win, I found myself purposely delaying for many turns. Bouncing the Root-kin with [Momentary Blink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Momentary Blink), my 1-of [Zameck Guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zameck Guildmage) and both Vensers, she got me so much card advantage and had a huge body. Ixidron became more of a late game finisher than the aggro/control creature I always pictured it.  
  
Might not be half bad with [Fungal Behemoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fungal Behemoth) either. If I could change anything, it might be to either give her a 2/2 body, or reduce CMC to 1(g)(u), but what do I know. <3 this card, 5/5
posts.html:
I recently added two copies of this to a Simic deck that I've been running for years. Ended up being very sexy alongside Plaxcaster Frogling, and she turns Cytoplast Root-kin into a two-card draw 90% of the time.

Honestly, even though the point of the deck is to play Ixidron and use your buffed morph creatures to win, I found myself purposely delaying for many turns. Bouncing the Root-kin with Momentary Blink, my 1-of Zameck Guildmage and both Vensers, she got me so much card advantage and had a huge body. Ixidron became more of a late game finisher than the aggro/control creature I always pictured it.

Might not be half bad with Fungal Behemoth either. If I could change anything, it might be to either give her a 2/2 body, or reduce CMC to 1(g)(u), but what do I know. <3 this card, 5/5

Posted By: psychichobo (3/24/2013 4:44:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In my opinion, the Simic are the best designed guild in Gatecrash. Not ridiculously efficient like the Boros, nor frustratingly weak like the Dimir.  
Evolve is really a hit-or-miss mechanic, that could easily go over- or underpowered, just like Cipher. The problem with Cipher isn't the mechanic - it's a marvellous idea which could be very good if done right - it's the cards. When the best card with a mechanic is a mediocre common ([Hands of Binding](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hands of Binding)), you know something's wrong.  
That's not the case with Evolve. There are only two Evolving creatures that I'd never play (looking at you, [Clinging Anemones](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clinging Anemones) and [Simic Fluxmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Fluxmage)), and all the rest are fantastic.  
With amazing rares - this, [Simic Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Manipulator) and especially [Gyre Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gyre Sage) - and great un/commons, Evolve is still my favorite mechanic. Stay awesome, and I hope we see more of that in Dragon's Maze!
posts.html:
In my opinion, the Simic are the best designed guild in Gatecrash. Not ridiculously efficient like the Boros, nor frustratingly weak like the Dimir.
Evolve is really a hit-or-miss mechanic, that could easily go over- or underpowered, just like Cipher. The problem with Cipher isn't the mechanic - it's a marvellous idea which could be very good if done right - it's the cards. When the best card with a mechanic is a mediocre common (Hands of Binding), you know something's wrong.
That's not the case with Evolve. There are only two Evolving creatures that I'd never play (looking at you, Clinging Anemones and Simic Fluxmage), and all the rest are fantastic.
With amazing rares - this, Simic Manipulator and especially Gyre Sage - and great un/commons, Evolve is still my favorite mechanic. Stay awesome, and I hope we see more of that in Dragon's Maze!
